text: Americus is a city in Lyon County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 776 people lived there. ==History== Americus was planned out in Fall 1857. It was named after Amerigo Vespucci. Americus was a station and shipping point on the Missouri–Kansas–Texas Railroad. ==Geography== Americus is at (38.506448, -96.259598). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ==People== Americus is part of the Emporia Micropolitan Statistical Area. ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 776 people, 324 households, and 216 families living in Americus. Of the households, 79.0% owned their home and 21.0% rented their home. The median age was 39.9 years. Of the people, 92.0% were White, 0.8% were from some other race, and 7.1% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 5.0% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 894 people, 354 households, and 251 families living in Americus. ==Education== Americus is served by USD 251 North Lyon County. The Northern Heights High School mascot is Wildcats. ==Famous people== *Ross Grimsley, Major League Baseball pitcher in the 1950s. *Grant Timmerman, U.S. Marine posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor during World War II. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Americus * Americus - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 251, local school district ;Maps * Americus City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Lyon County, Kansas Category:1857 establishments in Kansas Territory
title: Americus, Kansas
